subject: Economics
title: Mechanism Design: Engineering Outcomes from Rules
description: A 60-second lesson on Mechanism Design: Engineering Outcomes from Rules.

hook.text: Game theory asks: given the rules, what will players do? Mechanism design asks the reverse.

buildup.text: Leonid Hurwicz, Roger Myerson, and Eric Maskin won the Nobel Prize for mechanism design.

discovery.text: The Vickrey-Clarke-Groves mechanism makes it optimal for every player to reveal their true preferences.

twist.text: Perfect mechanisms are theoretically beautiful but practically brittle.

climax.text: Mechanism design is the economics of rule-making.

punchline.text: Good institutions don't require good people. They require good rules.

quiz.question: How does mechanism design differ from traditional game theory?
